intro: Dielytra canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian dielytra, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dielytra canadensis is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wet meadows.
